term.name: polytheism
term.source: From Greek poly: many, and from Greek theos: god.
term.def: A form of &theism; holding that there is more than one god; it is compatible with &henotheism; but incompatible with &monotheism;, by which it was supplanted in the history of Western religion. Polytheism was the dominant view in ancient Greek and Roman religion, whereas Judaism, &christianity;, and &islam; are monotheistic.
